TopicTitle: Suggestions for cargo for my modular colony ship

Articles.Content:
Recently I have been constructing a modular ship in Kerbin orbit with plans to send it to duna to start a base.

Unfortunately I have been stuck as to what I'm actually going to send there.

If anyone can give me any suggestions or even craft files that would be great.

Fuel?

That design has given me an idea. Might try for the largest fuel tug I can muster.

As to cargo. Hmmmm. A self contained lander? Something the size and shape of the hitch hiker pods. But flyable.

An atmospheric craft is always sweet too.
Maybe coms center, mobile base, rover, (could make a mobile base and have a small rover bay) ummm what else. Oh a defence system. Hope these ideas help!

you might probably want to add on a node which has all the different sized docking ports so that you can have some probes to go down planet-side first to find a good landing site for a base to land, and for some larger maybe SSTO's to link up to this main orbiter move resources from land to space and vice-versa
Thank you for all your ideas I am really considering the possibilities you have suggested.

-Rover

-Lander

-Living cans

just as I did: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36214-Manned-Extraplanetary-Vessels

Don't be stupid like me and take with you some kind of unmanned transport so you can ascent from Duna with all your crew in one go. I forgot about that and now I can't send them back to Kerbin.

BTW I like the design. How did you make the Sr. docking ports tilt like that?

Edited June 23, 2013 by Veeltch

I think if your bringing rovers, then you should take a couple tunacan-tanks with a docking port so your rover can transfer fuel between rockets?

That would be pretty awesome.

Oh, and atmosphere gliders/planes (remember jet engines don't work on Duna) would be nice too.
